alert.note: Alert for Coshocton (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 02 at 3:34AM EST until January 03 at 10:00PM EST by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Ohio... Muskingum River At Coshocton affecting Coshocton County.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at weather.gov/pbz. OHC031-022045- /O.EXT.KPBZ.FL.W.0001.220102T1200Z-220104T0300Z/ /CSHO1.1.ER.220102T1200Z.220103T0000Z.220103T2100Z.NO/ 334 AM EST Sun Jan 2 2022 ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Muskingum River At Coshocton. * WHEN...From this morning to late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Water reaches low lying areas between Tuscarawas and Walhonding Rivers just upstream of the confluence of the two rivers. At 15.0 feet, Low areas are flooded and water reaches a few homes along Route 16 south of Coshocton and along County Route 1A north of Coshocton. At 16.0 feet, Flood waters begin to affect the Lake Park area along the Walhonding River and begins backwater flooding along Mill Creek north of Lake Park and along Route 83. Flood waters will begin to enter yards in low-lying areas along County Route 1A. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 AM EST Sunday the stage was 14.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this morning to a crest of 15.6 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 15.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
